<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Try to create a MachOPlatform instance, adding the ORC runtime to the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// given JITDylib.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The ORC runtime requires access to a number of symbols in libc++, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// requires access to symbols in libobjc, and libswiftCore to support</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Objective-C and Swift code. It is up to the caller to ensure that the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// required symbols can be referenced by code added to PlatformJD. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// standard way to achieve this is to first attach dynamic library search</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// generators for either the given process, or for the specific required</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// libraries, to PlatformJD, then to create the platform instance:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\code&#123;.cpp&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   auto &amp;PlatformJD = ES.createBareJITDylib(&quot;stdlib&quot;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   PlatformJD.addGenerator(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ExitOnErr(EPCDynamicLibrarySearchGenerator</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                 ::GetForTargetProcess(EPC)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ES.setPlatform(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ExitOnErr(MachOPlatform::Create(ES, ObjLayer, EPC, PlatformJD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                                     &quot;/path/to/orc/runtime&quot;)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Alternatively, these symbols could be added to another JITDylib that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PlatformJD links against.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Clients are also responsible for ensuring that any JIT&#39;d code that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// depends on runtime functions (including any code using TLV or static</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// destructors) can reference the runtime symbols. This is usually achieved</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// by linking any JITDylibs containing regular code against</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// PlatformJD.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// By default, MachOPlatform will add the set of aliases returned by the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// standardPlatformAliases function. This includes both required aliases</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (e.g. &#95;&#95;cxa&#95;atexit -&gt; &#95;&#95;orc&#95;rt&#95;macho&#95;cxa&#95;atexit for static destructor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// support), and optional aliases that provide JIT versions of common</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// functions (e.g. dlopen -&gt; &#95;&#95;orc&#95;rt&#95;macho&#95;jit&#95;dlopen). Clients can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// override these defaults by passing a non-None value for the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// RuntimeAliases function, in which case the client is responsible for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// setting up all aliases (including the required ones).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;MachOPlatform&gt;</a>&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/machoplatform/#ad166f5736231229286c93cd8c6aa8b6d">Create</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/objectlinkinglayer">ObjectLinkingLayer</a> &amp;ObjLinkingLayer, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> &amp;PlatformJD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">         std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;DefinitionGenerator&gt; OrcRuntime,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">         <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/orc/machoplatform/headeroptions">HeaderOptions</a> PlatformJDOpts = &#123;&#125;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/machoplatform/#a93b754ab1a755ecf25e98f2bea459d8d">MachOHeaderMUBuilder</a> BuildMachOHeaderMU = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/machoplatform/#a49136cf1b05dde0d5cea41910deb238e">buildSimpleMachOHeaderMU</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">         std::optional&lt;SymbolAliasMap&gt; RuntimeAliases = std::nullopt);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Construct using a path to the ORC runtime.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;MachOPlatform&gt;</a>&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/machoplatform/#ad166f5736231229286c93cd8c6aa8b6d">Create</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/objectlinkinglayer">ObjectLinkingLayer</a> &amp;ObjLinkingLayer, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> &amp;PlatformJD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal">         </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;OrcRuntimePath, HeaderOptions PlatformJDOpts = &#123;&#125;,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/machoplatform/#a93b754ab1a755ecf25e98f2bea459d8d">MachOHeaderMUBuilder</a> BuildMachOHeaderMU = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/machoplatform/#a49136cf1b05dde0d5cea41910deb238e">buildSimpleMachOHeaderMU</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Request that that the given symbols be materialized. The bool element of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is optional. If any required symbol is not found then the pushSymbols</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// function will return an error.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
